intro: Anthistiria barbata, commonly known as the hairy anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Anthistiria barbata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
